sentences.english: They dishonored her so much that she turned from them in disgust.
sentences.chinese: 她受玷污之后，遂即厌弃了他们。

sentences.english: Former call he now have defiled my only self-esteem.
sentences.chinese: 昔日称兄道弟的他现在竟玷污了我唯一的自尊。

sentences.english: These are they who have not been defiled with women, for they are virgins.
sentences.chinese: 这些人未曾与妇女在一起受到玷污，他们原是童身。

sentences.english: What is it that defiles you?
He stained his military record by going AWOL [a.w.o.l.=absent without official leave].
sentences.chinese: 他因擅离职守而玷污了军绩。

sentences.english: This basic principle is what defiles the mind, and when the mind is defiled, every thought is defiled.
sentences.chinese: 就是这个基本根源玷污了我们的内心。

sentences.english: The word "defiled" means to take on some form of ritual impurity.
sentences.chinese: 玷污“这个词指的是呈现一些不纯洁仪式的形式。

sentences.english: The American model has also been seriously tarnished by the Bush administration's use of torture.
sentences.chinese: 布什政府的歪曲使用使得美国模式被严重的玷污了。

sentences.english: Whoever corrects a scoffer wins abuse; whoever rebukes the wicked gets hurt.
sentences.chinese: 指斥亵慢人的必受辱骂，责备恶人的必被玷污。

sentences.english: He never dirtied his hands with political intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 他从不参与政治阴谋玷污自己。

sentences.english: His reputation was blemished by a newspaper article alleging he had taken bribes.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上一篇文章说他纳贿，他的光荣以是遭到玷污。

sentences.english: It is our sins, our transgressions against God’s Law, that defile us.
sentences.chinese: 是我们的罪过违反了上帝的法则，使我们受到玷污。

sentences.english: If it is profit-driven, some people believe this kind of benevolence is tainted.
sentences.chinese: 如果它被利益驱动，人们就会认为这种善行被玷污了。

sentences.english: This in turn has tarnished their reputation as the world's economic powerhouses.
sentences.chinese: 这转而玷污他们作为世界经济中心的声誉。

sentences.english: He refused to imbrue his hands with the blood of more killing.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝杀更多人以血玷污双手。

sentences.english: You'll go back to desecrating these people's land, blowing up palm trees?
sentences.chinese: 你要过去玷污这些人的土地，炸掉他们的棕榈树？

definition: to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
